reviews.text: This is a very interesting place if you are into history and how people used to live
Excellent, lovely village surroundings. Well worth a look.
Interesting place for anyone with an interest in the Romans. It’s fascinating to see what a fort would have been like. There’s also lots to do for children.

Visited Lunt Roman Fort as part of a school trip (this was the third year the school has visited). Thankfully it was a lovely day so we were able to fully enjoy it.

The staff were dressed up in appropriate costumes and were very informative.  The class had a great time taking part in a tour of the grounds (while marching like the Romans!) and learning about the living quarters and training of soldiers who would have lived in the Fort.

Overall it was a great day out which the children enjoyed and were talking about for over a week after our visit.
If you like old men dressed up as Romans this is the place to come. The fort isnt anything more than a garden shed...
Very well preserved example of medieval building. It's really worth spending an hour or so. The staff is very helpful and ready to answer any questions. Will be returning for sure.
Attended for a live action roleplaying event - very fitting venue, beautiful inside.
Just popped in for a cuppa to have a look. Very nice bit of history down there. Very well maintained and service from staff was very pleasant.

Went here 2 years ago on my vacation.  Found it by accident walking from the cathedral.  So glad I did. The history of this building is incredible.  It is quite stunning in the main hall.  And the rooms upstairs are awesome too.this is truly a Coventry gem to be seen.

A beautiful building verging on the prestige of an ornate chapel. To be honest it has bags of character in its own right. As an events venue your guests would be awed. I visited as a tourist and was wowed but I was left wanting more about the history and historical use of the building. Each room only had a page of writing to read. Saying that, the assistant on the desk had a lot more information and was a pleasure to chat with.

Went for the TedX event. The cafe outside the auditorium was only serving drinks, and it would have been much better if they had been doing hot food as well as we had to traipse around finding food that wasn't from an outside vendor. Nice big auditorium, but uncomfortable plastic chairs.

Excellent gig venue and I've yet to attend a comedy show (and I've attended a few!) where either the support or main act fails to mention something along the lines of... "where are we, Coventry or Warwick?! MAKE YOUR MIND UP!" which was funny the first few times...but now...
Been here many times. Tonight it was jazz, but there is also cinema and theatre. Excellent venue, but I will be pleased when the redevelopment work is finished.
Very nice place to see a concert. Plenty of parking nearby and easy access to the centre. Good quality food and drink. Staff friendly and welcoming. Can't think of anything against the whole evening.
Decent range of food and drink. Food was ok for the price. Indoor seating with relatively few windows to outside. Good service. Convenient if in Warwick Uni.

Really love going to the herbert art gallery. My son loves going round seeing and touching all the things he's allowed to touch. There was a photography gallery up recently which was beautiful. All of the pictures were amazing
Awesome place. Great, helpful staff. Interesting event are held here. What's not to like! The Spring Makers event was brilliant.

An understated art gallery with a family focus. The fixed exhibitions offer something for all ages, and the visiting exhibitions bring special interest displays.

A must for locals and visitors alike.
Good museum, huge collection on animal taxidermy. Been here a couple of times with the kids. Mindful quite a few poeple I have spoken too didn't even know it was there.
Love this place. Interesting, active and brilliant for young children. Cafe is super, good range of food and not vastly overpriced.
Incredibly wonderful park! I am surprised I hadn't discovered it before, it is truly a hidden gem. It's big, not very crowded, ideal for a long walk.

Great Park for families of all ages, safe play area for young children and adventure slides etc for older children. Plenty of open spaces for picnics in the summer and great open spaces to exercise your dog.
We are so lucky that this is our local park. It's so lovely. The best to us

This park has a nice playground for children and  smooth tarmac paths suitable for pushchairs and wheelchairs. Has gorgeous wildflowers throughout summer, a pond, a walled garden, golf. It does have a reasonable slope if you plan to run or cycle here but there are benches if you need to rest. Kept pretty clean, lots of dog walkers come here and largely they clean up after themselves.
Great place for a walk. Dogs have to be on lead some of the time . If you have little  ones  there is an amazing fairy garden too. Beautiful place.

A beautiful park where nature thrives. It has everything; a river , a wooded area, a wetland and a large grassland area. If you come looking for the lake, you'll be disappointed though. Undeveloped (which is a positive) and great for dogs (depends on your opinion of dogs really). Currently undergoing a face-lift to encourage more wildlife, so expect to see fenced off areas and freshly dug holes. Still enough of the park is accessible for a calm peaceful walk.
An often quiet and thoughtful space. You feel very in touch with the changing seasons here. Great for dog walkers 🔥🔥🔥
Great open space for walking the dogs or children, watching the kingfisher flying up and down the river.

A nicely undeveloped park with plenty of grassed open space for games, while small wooded areas provide shelter and some seclusion. Benches line a short paved trail, ideal for a relaxing stroll. I'd love to know how the small stream achieved river status though!
Pretentious dog walkers with aggressive dogs (sometimes)..  it's basically a big dog walking park. Which is a shame, as it's quite beautiful otherwise.

Absolutely fabulous venue, modern, clean and good sighting all round.  The only issue I have is with the staff who seem to treat visiting hockey teams as criminals and ask for a block separation between home and away supporters - that is really sad, and not what the sport is all about - please sort this out, we should be able to sit together - it is a family sport

Cinema experience here is usually ok. But if there is a problem they can't do anything about it unless they catch them in the act. The management are pretty good tho and gave me and my friend ticket each to return any time to watch another film... on them.
Great family night out especially if you're into Ice Hockey. Or just want to try Ice Skating.
Good ice rink, just high prices and too busy on saturdays
Brilliant. Easy parking near enough to the town and ive never been to the venue before but will be on the look out for events there in the future.

Great stadium with a good family arena. I went to see the football there and wasps Vs Newcastle. The tickets where free as season ticket holders get 3 free tickets a season so great money for value. There is a nice area under the stadium for food and event and where the netball is hosted. Lots of parking near and a good club shop.

Great place but it was very cold today and I would have loved a hot drink at half time. Sadly there were no separate coffee/tea bars and I would have had to join a very long queue at any of the bars where most people were buying alcohol. Could you not introduce separate coffee bars?

CONFERENCE EVENT REVIEW ONLY

The main areas were good with great views of the stage from all seats. The temperature was kept to a steady level all day. Seats were comfortable and electronic displays were clear.  The breakout rooms were great too but there were 2 major flaws that brought the rating to 3 from 5 stars. 

As the conference was a largely attended event, when it came to lunch, there was insufficient tables and chairs. People were sat on the floor eating or precariously balancing a plate and trying to cut their food. Not very professional. 

Secondly, you needed to get an exit ticket for the car park. Unfortunately there were only 2 machines where you could get these. When there are over 600 delegates, that's a queue at the end of the day, you don't want! Also they were at the opposite side of the stadium.

Overall, a couple of quick fixes would make this a 5 star venue.
We went to see our first top tier rugby game at the Ricoh. Loved the atmosphere and venue, and there was a wide choice of good value snacks. Will definitely be going again.
Great stadium, with good facilities good food, beer and good  Rugby and Netball. Ricoh Arena station is next to Ricoh Arena  stadium, transport links very  good. Worth a visit.
Excellent Training Facilities

Went for a party, great venue and a lovely view over the rugby pitches.  Loads of easy parking (it wasn't a match day) and everything clean and up to scratch. Would certainly consider for future events
Home of Broadstreet RFC

I've never seen anything like it. At first I thought it absurd and perhaps even grotesque, but, with time I've grown fond of it, and it is what moved me to take some nice shots. It complements the transport museum and the adjacent Swanswell Gate very nicely.

Just a shame that the horrendously ugly Sainsbury's is just an eye flicker away.

A good idea. Adds to the culture of the city and is well represented by the statue at the base of the arches informing you what it's all about. Sadly, at night, the area can attract some unsavoury characters. In the day time, be careful of the buses using the junction!
It's a great view of Coventry.
Looks cool makes a normal average area stand out a bit
It's initially unclear to an observer that what it is and means. The structure looks tired and covered in dirt. The whole square needs work to bring it to life.
Great Gluten Free cakes made by owners mother Mary. Left two messages for owner to contact me, still waiting!!!!!!
Love the bacon batches at Conroys. What can be better than sitting in the sun for lunch 😊😊
Great park cafe. Good selection of cold and hot drinks, ice creams and snacks and cakes, many home made. V friendly staff

Beautiful well prepared food. Prepared in very good time, especially when you have a 45 minute lunch break, i get time to eat and chill out for 10 minutes. Staff are well mannered and very polite 😊 one of my favourite places.
Nice, unpretentious, Park cafe. Healthy & indulgent options available. Gluten free catered for. Indoor and outdoor seating. We come here often. Fab for after a run in the park.
Great food.  Brilliant breakfast , good coffee and really pleasant service in a clean cafe.  What a pleasant change.
Good traditional British cafe style food at decent prices. It's a relief to have a proper breakfast cafe in the centre of Cov.
Lovely Breakfast  quick servers ,would recommend it to my friends .
Amazing food, not alot of inside seating but usally enough
Very nice friendly staff really good value for money. Excellent .Colin

The food here was amazing, I was part of a party of 12 so we had the set party menu. The starters were the best bit, the meat was beautifully spiced. The main courses were nice also and was good to try something new. The reason for the 2 star wasn't because of the food, it was due to a member of our group having £40 stolen from his wallet by a member of staff. The manager watched the cctv back and seen the staff member taking the money out of his wallet when it was hanging up on the coat rack. The restaurant gave the money back but it left a cloud over the night in the end.

This is a real experience. Excellent service with knowledgeable and witty staff. Every dish is unique and bespoke. The setting is cosy and the decor is sumptuous. It's had an excellent reputation since it opened in 2001, but they have hugely upped the game in the last few years and really worked the uniqueness of the food they offer. Highly recommend.

Spent a lovely evening here. Decor is great and in a lovely order style building. The food was amazing ,very interesting flavours with a beautiful presentation. These restaurant really deserve Michelin star. Thank you for a beautiful night there!

We had lovely night eating out at this restaurant, amazing food (taste and presentation) lovely staff very friendly and attentive. With a special extra touch added at the end, by bringing me a cake out singing happy birthday 😀 Thank you!! Definitely recommend..

Visited restaurant this evening after reading reviews online. Travelled from Birmingham with my wife and two children only to be refused entry - reason being they don't allow children to dine at the restaurant (serving waiter whom I presume was the manager said it is claerly stated on website) and the front of house waitress lied and said they require tables to be pre-booked and they are fully booked anyway.

As we are being told this, two men walk into the restaurant without booking and were seated. So, clearly booking wasn't required and they weren't fully booked. Moreover, we were there at 18.30 when the restaurant was nearly empty.

Anyway, in an attempt to avoid confrontation, I took my family back to the car and checked the website - nothing about not letting children in. So, I went back in to ask where on the website it said that children aren't allowed at which point the guy got agitated, angry and started yelling. He did not offer an explanation and kept shouting at me to go out. I asked the lying waitress directly if they are fully booked and she then knew I was onto her and she then did not repeat that they were fully booked. 

Absolutely disgusting and vile behaviour from staff!

I have recorded the event if anyone wants to see it please get in touch.

A good place to be in for a lousy evening. I had been in Habibi twice and the food was yum each time! It's a very popular place among students at Warwick, so worth checking it out. The seating upstairs is quite cozy. A good place to be in for people planning to dine in groups, as some of the food on menu comes as sharer! I will strongly recommend this place. But the waiting time could be a bit longer and the bills can be a bit pricey depending on how much your budget is.

The food was amazing (like, seriously). We sat in the outside tent, which is really beautiful and makes for a good experience on top of the good food. Portions are on the smaller side, so order accordingly.
What a discovery! Probably the friendliest restaurant we've ever visited. Beautifully cooked Palestinian food at a reasonable price with full vegetarian and vegan choice.
Great food but portions tend to change. Love the service provided and the decorations.

Great place to eat.
Great hospitality and service from the owner and one of the best Arabian restaurants in Midland.

Absolutely fabulous venue, modern, clean and good sighting all round.  The only issue I have is with the staff who seem to treat visiting hockey teams as criminals and ask for a block separation between home and away supporters - that is really sad, and not what the sport is all about - please sort this out, we should be able to sit together - it is a family sport

Cinema experience here is usually ok. But if there is a problem they can't do anything about it unless they catch them in the act. The management are pretty good tho and gave me and my friend ticket each to return any time to watch another film... on them.
Great family night out especially if you're into Ice Hockey. Or just want to try Ice Skating.
Good ice rink, just high prices and too busy on saturdays
Brilliant. Easy parking near enough to the town and ive never been to the venue before but will be on the look out for events there in the future.
Excellent food.  Lovely atmospheres. Fair prices. Just perfect. I would highly recommend
Restaurant's setting is really pleasant. I found the couscous tasted very good, they could probably be more generous with the portion though.
Really nice place with delicious food and cosy atmosphere. Good tea creme brulee and tajin. Will recomend it.
Very good food, they only need to improve their service.

Pros:
- The staff is very welcoming, good at English and will give you good service. [5/5]
- The food tastes fresh, perfectly cooked and is well seasoned. [4/5]
The atmosphere is warm and looks very pretty. The lighting, colours and furniture is in good harmony and everything feels well thought out. [4.5/5]

Cons:
- None to speak of.
